skill.name: azure-resource-visualizer
skill.description: Analyze Azure resource groups and generate detailed Mermaid architecture diagrams showing the relationships between individual resources.
skill.summary: Generate Mermaid diagrams from Azure resource groups to visualize infrastructure topology and dependencies
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: All 88 static findings are false positives. The flagged patterns (backtick commands, IP addresses, crypto algorithms, system reconnaissance) are actually documentation examples of Azure CLI commands, example IP addresses in Mermaid diagrams, and Mermaid syntax. This is a read-only Azure documentation skill that generates architecture diagrams.

high_findings.title: False Positive: External Commands Flag
high_findings.description: Static analyzer flagged 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' - these are documentation examples of Azure CLI commands (e.g., `az resource list`, `az graph query`), not actual code execution
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backticks in these files are used for documenting CLI syntax, not executing shell commands. The skill is documentation/reference content.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Hardcoded IP Addresses
high_findings.description: Static analyzer flagged IP addresses - these are example addresses in Mermaid diagram documentation (10.0.0.0/16, 10.0.1.0/24)
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: IP addresses appear in example Mermaid diagram documentation showing how to document network resources, not in actual network code.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm
high_findings.description: Static analyzer incorrectly flagged Mermaid diagram syntax (`-->` arrows) as crypto algorithms
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: The '-->' pattern is Mermaid diagram syntax for directed edges, not cryptographic code.

high_findings.title: False Positive: System Reconnaissance
high_findings.description: Static analyzer flagged Azure service names (virtual network, subnet) as reconnaissance
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: References to Azure services like 'virtual network' and 'subnet' are legitimate documentation about cloud infrastructure.

content.user_title: Visualize Azure Architecture with Mermaid Diagrams
content.value_statement: Understand complex Azure infrastructure by generating detailed Mermaid diagrams that map resource relationships, dependencies, and configurations across your entire resource group.
actual_capabilities: Query Azure resource groups to discover all resources
Generate detailed Mermaid flow diagrams showing resource relationships
Document network topology including VNets, subnets, and private endpoints
Map data flows between Azure services like App Service, Functions, SQL, and Storage
Create comprehensive architecture documentation with resource inventories
limitations: Read-only analysis - cannot create, modify, or delete Azure resources
Does not perform security scanning or vulnerability assessment
Does not provide performance troubleshooting or diagnostics
Does not generate code for Azure resource deployment

use_cases.title: Document Existing Infrastructure
use_cases.description: Create up-to-date architecture diagrams for legacy Azure deployments to improve team understanding and onboarding

use_cases.title: Prepare for Migration Projects
use_cases.description: Visualize current resource relationships before migrating to new subscriptions or Azure regions

use_cases.title: Audit Resource Dependencies
use_cases.description: Identify all dependencies before making changes to production resources to avoid disruption

prompt_templates.title: Basic Resource Group Diagram
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the architecture of my Azure resource group called [resource-group-name]. Create a Mermaid diagram showing all resources and how they connect.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick visualization of a specific resource group

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Network Topology
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the network architecture in resource group [resource-group-name]. Create a detailed diagram showing VNets, subnets, NSGs, private endpoints, and how compute resources connect to them.

prompt_templates.title: Data Flow Mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Map all data flows in resource group [resource-group-name]. Show how data moves between App Services, Functions, Databases, and Storage accounts. Include connection strings and authentication methods.

prompt_templates.title: Full Architecture Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create comprehensive architecture documentation for resource group [resource-group-name]. Include: resource inventory table, Mermaid diagram with subgraphs by layer, relationship details, and recommendations.

output_examples.input: Show me the architecture of my Azure resource group called 'production-web-app'
output_examples.output:
Creates a markdown file with:

- Resource inventory table listing all Azure resources
- Mermaid diagram grouped by layer (Network, Compute, Data, Security)
- Node labels showing SKUs, tiers, and key settings
- Connection arrows labeled with data flow types
- Notes section with observations

output_examples.input: Map the network topology for resource group 'api-backend'
output_examples.output:
Generates a focused network diagram showing:

- Virtual Networks with address spaces
- Subnets with CIDR ranges
- Network Security Groups and rules
- Private endpoints and connections
- How compute resources connect to the network

best_practices: Wait for user confirmation on which resource group to analyze before proceeding
Include configuration details like SKUs, tiers, and settings in diagram labels
Group resources logically using Mermaid subgraphs by layer or purpose
Label all connections with descriptive data flow or dependency information
anti_patterns: Skipping resources that seem unimportant - include everything in the resource group
Making assumptions about relationships without verifying them
Creating incomplete or placeholder diagrams without all resources
Omitting configuration details that affect architecture understanding

faq.question: Does this skill modify my Azure resources?
faq.answer: No. This is a read-only analysis skill. It only reads and visualizes your existing resources without making any changes.

faq.question: What diagram format does this skill use?
faq.answer: It generates Mermaid diagrams, which render as flowcharts in most markdown viewers and documentation platforms.

faq.question: Can I diagram multiple resource groups at once?
faq.answer: Yes, you can analyze each resource group separately or use Azure Resource Graph for cross-subscription queries.

faq.question: Does this skill work with all Azure resource types?
faq.answer: Yes, it can discover and visualize any Azure resource type deployed in your resource group.

faq.question: How detailed are the generated diagrams?
faq.answer: Diagrams include resource names, types, SKUs, tiers, network settings, and relationship connections. The detail level is suitable for architecture documentation.

faq.question: Can I use this for security analysis?
faq.answer: This skill provides visualization only. For security scanning, use dedicated Azure security skills.
